intro: Evaiezoa retusa, commonly known as the smoothleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing characteristics. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, opposite leaves that are smooth and lance-shaped. Its small, greenish-yellow flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Evaiezoa retusa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
